intro: Olsynium frigidum, commonly known as the cold mountain grass, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its botanical classification places it within the family Poaceae, which includes grasses and sedges. Olsynium frigidum is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
